className.description: CSS classes to be added to triggering button.

id.description: A unique ID is needed in order to support keyboard navigation, ARIA support, and connect the dropdown to the triggering button. This is provided by the `MenuDropdown`. Please use `MenuDropdown` to set.

isOpen.description: Informs the trigger on the open/close state of the dropdown menu

menu.description: By Default the dropdown menu is inside a `Dialog` component.

onBlur.description: Is only called when `openOn` is set to `hover` and when the triggering button loses focus.

onClick.description: This prop is passed onto the triggering `Button`. Triggered when the trigger button is clicked.

onFocus.description: Is only called when `openOn` is set to `hover` and when the triggering button gains focus.

onMouseDown.description: Called when mouse clicks down on the trigger button.

onMouseEnter.description: Called when mouse hovers over the trigger button. This is only called if `this.props.openOn` is set to `hover`.

onMouseLeave.description: Called when mouse hover leaves the trigger button. This is only called if `this.props.openOn` is set to `hover`.

openOn.description: Determines if mouse hover or click opens the dropdown menu. The default of `click` is highly recommended to comply with accessibility standards. If you are planning on using hover, please pause a moment and reconsider.

triggerRef.description: The ref of the actual triggering button.

triggerClassName.description: CSS classes to be added to wrapping trigger `div` around the button.

button-trigger.name: button-trigger

modal.description: The Modal component is used for the Lightning Design System Modal and Notification > Prompt components. The Modal opens from a state change outside of the component itself (pass this state to the isOpen prop). For more details on the Prompt markup, please review the Notifications > Prompt. By default, `Modal` will add `aria-hidden=true` to the `body` tag, but this disables some assistive technologies. To prevent this you can add the following to your application with `#mount` being the root node of your application that you would like to hide from assistive technologies when the `Modal` is open. ``` import settings from 'design-system-react/components/settings'; settings.setAppElement('#mount'); ``` This component uses a portalMount (a disconnected React subtree mount) to create a modal as a child of `body`.

ariaHideApp.description: Boolean indicating if the appElement should be hidden.

assistiveText.description:
**Assistive text for accessibility.**
This object is merged with the default props object on every render.
* `dialogLabel`: This is a visually hidden label for the dialog. If not provided, `title` is used.
* `closeButton`: This is a visually hidden label for the close button.

children.description: Modal content.

containerClassName.description: Custom CSS classes for the modal's container. This is the element with `.slds-modal__container`. Use `classNames` [API](https://github.com/JedWatson/classnames).

contentClassName.description: Custom CSS classes for the modal's body. This is the element that has overflow rules and should be used to set a static height if desired. Use `classNames` [API](https://github.com/JedWatson/classnames).

contentStyle.description: Custom styles for the modal's body. This is the element that has overflow rules and should be used to set a static height if desired.

directional.description: If true, modal footer buttons render left and right. An example use case would be for "back" and "next" buttons.

dismissible.description: If true, Modals can be dismissed by clicking on the close icon or pressing esc key.

dismissOnClickOutside.description: If true, Modals can be dismissed by clicking outside of modal. If unspecified, defaults to dismissible.

onRequestClose.description: Callback to fire with Modal is dismissed

footer.description: Accepts a node or array of nodes that are typically a `Button` or `ProgressIndicator`. If an array, the nodes render on the right side first but are then floated left and right if directional prop is `true`.

header.description: Allows for a custom modal header that does not scroll with modal content. If this is defined, `title` and `tagline` will be ignored. The close button will still be present.

headerClassName.description: Adds CSS classes to the container surrounding the modal header and the close button. Use `classNames` [API](https://github.com/JedWatson/classnames).

isOpen.description: Forces the modal to be open or closed.

parentSelector.description: Function whose return value is the mount node to insert the Modal element into. The default is `() => document.body`.

portalClassName.description: Custom CSS classes for the portal DOM node. This node is a direct descendant of the `body` and is the parent of `ReactModal__Overlay`. Use `classNames` [API](https://github.com/JedWatson/classnames).

prompt.description: Styles the modal as a prompt.

size.description: Specifiies the modal's width. May be deprecated in favor of `width` in the future.

tagline.description: Content underneath the title in the modal header.

title.description: Text heading at the top of a modal.

toast.description: Allows adding additional notifications within the modal.

navigation.description: Navigation represents a list of links that either take the user to another page or parts of the page the user is in.

id.description: HTML id for component. _Tested with snapshot testing._

className.description: CSS class names to be added to the container element. _Tested with snapshot testing._

categories.description: Array of categories. The required shape is: `{id: string, label: string, items: array}`. The required shape of an item is `{id: string, label: string, url: string}`. All item ids are expected to be unique. _Tested with snapshot testing._

selectedId.description: The ID of the item that is currently selected. Defaults to the ID of the first item. _Tested with Mocha framework._

onSelect.description: Triggered when the selection changes. It receives an event and an item object in the shape: `event, {item: [object] }`. _Tested with Mocha framework._

variant.description: Determines component style. _Tested with snapshot testing._

panel.description: A panel provides detailed contextual information or contextual filtering options. [Filter](/components/filters/) component should be used as children. Menus within a Filter Popover will need to not have "portal mounts" and be inline.

children.description: The contents of the panel

filtering/group.description: A filtering panel contextual filtering options.

assistiveText.description:
**Assistive text for accessibility.**
This object is merged with the default props object on every render.
* `closeButton`: Localized description of the close button for the panel for screen readers

addFilterLabel.description: Localized description of the "Add Filter" button in the footer

cancelLabel.description: Label for button that cancels modified filters

children.description:
Pass in `FilterList`'s of `Filters`:

```
<FilterGroup
  variant="panel"
>
  <FilterList>
  <Filter
    property="Show Me"
    predicate="All Wackamoles"
  >
  {popoverContents}
  </Filter>
  </FilterList>
</FilterGroup>
```

errorLabel.description: Label for the error message at the top of the panel.

footer.description: Allows for customization of footer. This will be added after any `FilterList`'s in the DOM. If using Panel Filter Group outside of a panel, do not set the variant to `panel` and header and footer will be removed.

header.description: Allows for customization of header. This will be added before any `FilterList`'s in the DOM. If using Panel Filter Group outside of a panel, do not set the variant to `panel` and header and footer will be removed.

heading.description: The heading within the header of the filtering panel

modified.description: Shows confirmation heading. Please see `onRequestCancel` and `onRequestSave`.

onClickAdd.description: Callback triggered when "Add Filter" is clicked. Recieves an `event`.

onClickRemoveAll.description: Callback triggered when "Remove All" is clicked. Recieves an `event`.

onRequestCancel.description: When the panel's cancel button is clicked in order to reset filter panel to previous state.

onRequestClose.description: When the panel's close button is clicked. Please place Panel within another element to control position and visibility.

onRequestSave.description: When the panel's save button is clicked in order to confirm filter panel state.

removeAllLabel.description: Localized description of the "Remove All" button in the footer

saveLabel.description: Label for button that saves modified filters

variant.description: Adds in default Panel header and footer

filtering/group.name: filtering/group

filtering/list-heading.description: A filtering panel contextual filtering options.

isLocked.description: Displayed a heading for a locked list of filters

lockedHeading.description: Heading for a group of filters that are locked

filtering/list-heading.name: filtering/list-heading

filtering/list.description: A list of Filters. This is a higher order component for filters that decorates the filter to work within a Filtering Panel. It also adds support for a Filter error label.

children.description: Pass in `Filter` components

filtering/list.name: filtering/list

pill.description: A pill represents an object that can be viewed with or without an icon.

methods.name: focus
methods.docblock: Give focus to the Pill component.
methods.description: Give focus to the Pill component.

methods.name: restProps
methods.docblock: Extracts a set of custom properties. A custom property is a property, which is not described in propTypes of a component.
methods.description: Extracts a set of custom properties. A custom property is a property, which is not described in propTypes of a component.

assistiveText.description:
**Assistive text for accessibility**
This object is merged with the default props object on every render.
* `remove`: This is a visually hidden label for the close button.
_Tested with snapshot testing._

avatar.description:
SLDSAvatar component to show on the left of the pill.
_Tested with Mocha framework._

bare.description:
Applies the bare style to the component.
_Tested with Mocha framework._

children.description:
This is a way to specify custom contents for the pill in the case a simple text label is not enough.
_Tested with Mocha framework._

className.description:
CSS classes to be added to tag with `.slds-pill`. Uses `classNames` [API](https://github.com/JedWatson/classnames).
_Tested with Mocha framework._

hasError.description:
Applies the error style to the component.
_Tested with Mocha framework._

href.description:
An href to use if the pill is shown as a link.
_Tested with Mocha framework._

icon.description:
SLDSIcon component to show on the left of the pill.
_Tested with Mocha framework._

labels.description:
**Text labels for internationalization**
This object is merged with the default props object on every render.
* `label`: Pill's label.
* `title`: Pill's title.
* `removeTitle`: A title to use for the remove icon.

_Tested with snapshot testing._

onBlur.description:
`onBlur` callback executes when the component loses focus.
_Tested with Mocha framework._

onClick.description:
`onClick` callback executes when a user clicks on the pill or presses the Enter key.
_Tested with Mocha framework._

onFocus.description:
`onFocus` callback executes when the component receives focus.
_Tested with Mocha framework._

onKeyDown.description:
`onKeyDown` callback executes when a user presses a key.
_Tested with Mocha framework._

onRemove.description:
`onRemove` callback executes when a user clicks on the pill's remove icon or presses the delete or the backspace keys.
_Tested with Mocha framework._

variant.description:
A variant of a pill
_Tested with Mocha framework._

popover.description: The Popover component is a non-modal dialog. It should be paired with a clickable trigger such as a `Button`. It traps focus from the page and must be exited if focus needs to be outside the Popover. Use a `Tooltip` if there are no call to actions within the dialog. A `Tooltip` does not need to be clicked. Multiple popovers open at the same time, each with focus trap is not supported.

align.description: Aligns the popover with the respective side of the trigger. That is `top` will place the `Popover` above the trigger.

assistiveText.description:
**Assistive text for accessibility.**
This object is merged with the default props object on every render.
* `closeButton`: This is a visually hidden label for the close button.

ariaLabelledby.description: HTML `id` of heading for popover. Only use if your header is within your popover body.

children.description: The trigger of the component. This must be a **single node**. Many props will be passed into this trigger related to popover interactions. The child needs to be a clickable element, such as a `Button` or an anchor tag (`a`).

body.description: The contents of the popover. This should also accept arrays.

className.description: CSS classes to be added to the popover. That is the element with `.slds-popover` on it.

disabled.description: This prop is passed onto the triggering `Button`. Prevent popover from opening. Also applies disabled styling to trigger button.

footer.description: A footer is an optional. Buttons are often placed here.

hasStaticAlignment.description: Prevents the Popover from changing position based on the viewport/window. If set to true your popover can extend outside the viewport _and_ overflow outside of a scrolling parent. If this happens, you might want to consider making the popover contents scrollable to fit the menu on the screen. When enabled, `position` `absolute` is used.

heading.description: All popovers require a heading that labels the popover for assistive technology users. This text will be placed within a heading HTML tag. A heading is **highly recommended for accessibility reasons.** Please see `ariaLabelledby` prop.

id.description: By default, a unique ID will be created at render to support keyboard navigation, ARIA roles, and connect the popover to the triggering button. This ID will be applied to the triggering element. `${id}-popover`, `${id}-dialog-heading`, `${id}-dialog-body` are also created.

isOpen.description: Forces the popover to be open or closed. See controlled/uncontrolled callback/prop pattern for more on suggested use [](https://github.com/salesforce-ux/design-system-react/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#concepts-and-best-practices) You will want this if Popover is to be a controlled component.

offset.description: Offset adds pixels to the absolutely positioned dialog in the format: ([vertical]px [horizontal]px).

onClick.description: This function is passed onto the triggering `Button`. Triggered when the trigger button is clicked. You will want this if Popover is to be a controlled component.

onClose.description: This function is triggered when the dialog is closed. This occurs when the Dialog child component (that is the actual popover) is unmounted and removed from the DOM. This function returns `{event, { trigger, componentWillUnmount }`. Trigger can have the values `cancel`, `clickOutside`, or `newPopover`.

onKeyDown.description: Called when a key is pressed.

onMouseDown.description: Called when mouse clicks down on the trigger button.

onOpen.description: This function is triggered when the Dialog child component (that is the actual popover) is mounted and added to the DOM. The parameters are `event, { portal: }`. `portal` can be used as a React tree root node.

onRequestClose.description: This function is triggered when the user clicks outside the Popover or clicks the close button. You will want to define this if Popover is to be a controlled component. Most of the time you will want wnat to set `isOpen` to `false` when this is triggered unless you need to validate something.

position.description:
Please select one of the following:
* `absolute` - (default) The dialog will use `position: absolute` and style attributes to position itself. This allows inverted placement or flipping of the dialog.
* `overflowBoundaryElement` - The dialog will overflow scrolling parents. Use on elements that are aligned to the left or right of their target and don't care about the target being within a scrolling parent. Typically this is a popover or tooltip. Dropdown menus can usually open up and down if no room exists. In order to achieve this a portal element will be created and attached to `body`. This element will render into that detached render tree.
* `relative` - No styling or portals will be used. Menus will be positioned relative to their triggers. This is a great choice for HTML snapshot testing.

style.description: An object of CSS styles that are applied to the `slds-popover` DOM element.

overlay.description: If `true`, adds a transparent overlay when the menu is open to handle outside clicks. Allows clicks on iframes to be captured, but also forces a double-click to interact with other elements. If a function is passed, custom overlay logic may be defined by the app.

triggerClassName.description: CSS classes to be added to wrapping trigger `div` around the button.

page-header.description: The PageHeader component adds PageHeader, PageHeader.Info, PageHeader.Title, PageHeader.DetailRow, and PageHeader.DetailBlock.

className.description: Optional class name

label.description: The info property can be a string or a React element

title.description: The title property can be a string or a React element

info.description: The info property can be a string or a React element

iconName.description: Name of the icon. Visit Lightning Design System Icons to reference icon names.

iconPosition.description: If omitted, icon position is centered.

iconSize.description: Determines the size of the icon.

iconVariant.description: For icon variants, please reference Lightning Design System Icons.

contentRight.description: Content to appear on the right hand side of the page header

details.description: An array of buttons which appear on the component's right hand side.

navRight.description: Nav content which appears in the upper right hand corner.

trail.description: An array of react elements presumably anchor <a> elements.

progress-indicator.description: Progress Indicator is a component that communicates to the user the progress of a particular process.

methods.name: getId
methods.docblock: Get the progress indicator's HTML id. Generate a new one if no ID present.
methods.description: Get the progress indicator's HTML id. Generate a new one if no ID present.

assistiveText.description:
**Assistive text for accessibility**
This object is merged with the default props object on every render.
* `completedStep`: Label for a completed step. The default is `Completed Step`
* `disabledStep`: Label for disabled step. The default is `Disabled Step`
* `errorStep`: Label for a step with an error. The default is `Error Step`
* `percentage`: Label for Progress Bar. The default is `Progress: [this.props.value]%`. You will need to calculate the percentage yourself if changing this string.
* `step`: Label for a step. It will be typically followed by the number of the step such as "Step 1".

className.description: CSS class names to be added to the container element. `array`, `object`, or `string` are accepted.

completedSteps.description: Stores all completed steps. It is an array of step objects.

disabledSteps.description:
Stores all disabled steps. It is an array of step objects. Steps are still clickable/focusable,
this only disables cursor change and removes onClick and onFocus event callbacks.

errorSteps.description: Stores all error steps. It is an array of step objects and usually there is only one error step, the current step. If an error occurs a second error icon should be placed to the left of related confirmation buttons (e.g. Cancel, Save) and an Error Popover should appear indicating there are errors. These additional items are NOT part of this component. This note was included for visibility purposes. Please refer to [SLDS website](https://www.lightningdesignsystem.com/components/progress-indicator/) for full details **

id.description: HTML id for component.

onStepClick.description:
Triggered when an individual step is clicked. By default, it receives an event and returns step state and the step object clicked: `{ isCompleted, isDisabled, isError, isSelected, step }`. Users are able to pass a callback handleClick function in forms of: <function name>(event, data) where data is the callback result.
```
const handleStepClick = function(event, data) { console.log(data); };
  <ProgressIndicator onStepClick={handleStepClick} />
```

onStepFocus.description:
Triggered when an individual step is focused. By default, it receives an event and returns step state and the step object clicked: `{ isCompleted, isDisabled, isError, isSelected, step }`. Users are able to pass a callback handleClick function in forms of: <function name>(event, data) where data is the callback result.
```
const handleStepFocus = function(event, data) { console.log(data); };
  <ProgressIndicator onStepFocus={handleStepFocus} />
```

selectedStep.description: Represents the currently selected or active step. It is a step object.

steps.description:
It is an array of step objects in the following form:
```
 [{
   id: <PropTypes.number> or <PropTypes.string>, has to be unique
   label: <PropTypes.string>, representing the tooltip content
   assistiveText: <PropTypes.string>, The default is `[Step props.index + 1]: [status]`. Status is if the step has been completed or in an error state.
 }],
 ```

tooltipIsOpenSteps.description: Stores all steps with opened tooltips. This property is mainly for development purposes. The tooltip should only show on hover for the user.

progress-ring.description: Customizable and configurable progress ring. Will display progress in a circular progress bar factor, and is capable of displaying iconography inside of the ring structure.

methods.name: icon
methods.docblock:
Gets the icon to display
@returns {node} Icon

methods.name: themeClass
methods.docblock:
Gets the theme CSS class
@returns {string} Class name

id.description: HTML id for component.

className.description: CSS classes to be added to tag with `.slds-progress-ring`. Uses `classNames` [API](https://github.com/JedWatson/classnames).

theme.description: The theme applied to the ring.

icon.description: Overrides the icon to be displayed.

hasIcon.description: Display the icon associated with the theme.

radio.description:
A radio input that can have a single input checked at any one time. Radios should be wrapped with
a [RadioGroup](/components/radio-group) or [RadioButtonGroup](/components/radio-button-group)

aria-describedby.description: The ID of an element that describes this radio input. Often used for error messages.

checked.description: This is a controlled component. This radio is checked according to this value.

defaultChecked.description:
This is the initial value of an uncontrolled form element and is present only to provide compatibility
with hybrid framework applications that are not entirely React. It should only be used in an application
without centralized state (Redux, Flux). "Controlled components" with centralized state is highly recommended.
See [Code Overview](https://github.com/salesforce/design-system-react/blob/master/docs/codebase-overview.md#controlled-and-uncontrolled-components) for more information.

id.description: A unique ID that is used to associating a label to the `input` element. This ID is added to the `input` element.

label.description: The string or element that is shown as both the title and the label for this radio input.

name.description: The name of the radio input group.

onChange.description: This event fires when the radio selection changes.

value.description: The value of this radio input.

variant.description: Variant of the Radio button. Base is the default and button-group makes the radio button look like a normal button (should be a child of <RadioButtonGroup>).

split-view.description: Split view is used to navigate between records in a list while staying on the same screen.

assistiveText.description:
**Assistive text for accessibility**
* `toggleButtonOpen`: The button used to open the split view.
* `toggleButtonClose`: The button used to close the split view.

id.description: HTML Id for the component.

className.description: CSS classes to be added to the root `div` tag. Uses `classNames` [API](https://github.com/JedWatson/classnames).

isOpen.description: Sets the split view to be open or closed.

events.description:
Event Callbacks
* `onClose`: Triggered when the split view has closed.
* `onOpen`: Triggered when the split view has opened.

master.description:
The React component that is rendered in the master section.
You need to pass in an array of elements in order for the scrolling to in the SplitViewList to work correctly.
React requires that you also supply a unique `key` for each element [React Lists and Keys](https://reactjs.org/docs/lists-and-keys.html#keys).

masterWidth.description: The width of the master section.

detail.description: The React component that is rendered in the detail section.

header.description: The Split View Header takes the same properties as the [PageHeader](https://react.lightningdesignsystem.com/components/page-headers/) component.
header.name: header

listbox.description: The menu with the ARIA role of a listbox.

assistiveText.description:
**Assistive text for accessibility**
* `list`: aria label for the list
* `sort`
   * `sortedBy`: Clickable sort header for the list.
   * `descending`: Descending sorting.
   * `ascending`: Ascending sorting.

className.description: CSS classes to be added to the parent `div` tag.

events.description:
Event Callbacks
* `onSelect`: Called when a list item is selected.
   * event {object} List item click event
   * Meta {object}
      * selectedItems {array} List of selected items.
      * item {object} Last selected item.
* `onSort`: Called when the list is sorted.
   * event {object} Sort click event

id.description: HTML id for component.

labels.description:
**Text labels for internationalization**
* `header`: This is the header of the list.

sortDirection.description:
The direction of the sort arrow. Option are:
* SORT_OPTIONS.UP: `up`
* SORT_OPTIONS.DOWN: `down`

multiple.description: Allows multiple item to be selection

options.description:
The list of items.
It is recommended that you have a unique `id` for each item.

selection.description: Accepts an array of item objects. For single selection, pass in an array of one object.

unread.description: Accepts an array of item objects. For single unread, pass in an array of one object.

listItem.description:
Custom list item template for the list item content. The select and unread functionality wraps the custom list item.
This should be a React component that accepts props.

listbox.name: listbox

radio-group.description:
A styled select list that can have a single entry checked at any one time.
The RadioGroup component wraps [Radio](/components/radios) components, which should be used as children.

children.description: Children are expected to be Radio components.

className.description: Custom CSS classes added to the node.

labels.description:
**Text labels for internationalization**
This object is merged with the default props object on every render.
* `error`: Message to display when any of Checkboxes are in an error state.
* `label`: This label appears above the radio group.

onChange.description: This event fires when the radio selection changes.

required.description: Adds an indicator that this field is required.

name.description: The name of this radio group.

errorId.description: The ID of the error message, for linking to radio inputs with aria-describedby.

radio-button-group.description:
A styled select list that can have a single entry checked at any one time.
The RadioButtonGroup component wraps [Radio](/components/radios) components, which should be used as children.

children.description: Children are expected to be Radio components.

className.description: Custom CSS classes added to `slds-radio_button-group` node.

labels.description:
**Text labels for internationalization**
This object is merged with the default props object on every render.
* `error`: Message to display when any of Checkboxes are in an error state.
* `label`: This label appears above the button group.

onChange.description: This event fires when the radio selection changes.

required.description: Adds an indicator that this field is required.

name.description: The name of this radio group.

errorId.description: The ID of the error message, for linking to radio inputs with aria-describedby.

slider.description: The ability to style sliders with CSS varies across browsers. Using this component ensures sliders look the same everywhere.

aria-describedby.description: The `aria-describedby` attribute is used to indicate the IDs of the elements that describe the object. It is used to establish a relationship between widgets or groups and text that described them. This is very similar to aria-labelledby: a label describes the essence of an object, while a description provides more information that the user might need.

assistiveText.description:
Assistive text for accessibility**
`label`: Visually hidden label but read out loud by screen readers.

classNameContainer.description: Class names to be added to the outer container of the Slider.

defaultValue.description:
This is the initial value of an uncontrolled form element and is present
only to provide compatibility with hybrid framework applications that
are not entirely React. It should only be used in an application without
centralized state (Redux, Flux). "Controlled components" with centralized
state is highly recommended. See [Code Overview](https://github.com/salesforce/design-system-react/blob/master/docs/codebase-overview.md#controlled-and-uncontrolled-components) for more information.

disabled.description: Disables the Slider and prevents clicking it. Only available on the horizontal view.

errorText.description: Message to display when the Slider is in an error state. When this is present, also visually highlights the component as in error.

id.description: Set the HTML `id` of the slider.

label.description: This label appears above the Slider.

max.description: Maximum value of a specified range. Defaults to 100.

min.description: Minimum value of a specified range. Defaults to 0.

name.description: Name of the submitted form parameter.

onChange.description: This event fires whenever the user has modified the data of the control. This callback recieves the following parameters `event, { value: [string] }`.

onInput.description: This event fires when the value is committed. This callback recieves the following parameters `event, { value: [string] }`.

step.description: By default, the granularity is 1 and the value is always an integer. For example, If you need a value between 5 and 10, accurate to two decimal places, you should set the value of step to 0.01

value.description: The Slider should be a controlled component, and will always display this value. This should always be used if you are using a Flux/Redux framework.

vertical.description: Modifier that makes the slider vertical

spinner.description: Spinners are CSS loading indicators that should be shown when retrieving data or performing slow computations. In some cases, the first time a parent component loads, a stencil is preferred to indicate network activity.

assistiveText.description:
**Assistive text for accessibility.**
This object is merged with the default props object on every render.
* `label`: Assistive text that is read out loud to screen readers.

containerClassName.description: Custom css classes applied to Spinner container

id.description: Unique html id placed on div with role="status".

isInput.description: Add styling to support a spinner inside an input field.

size.description: Determines the size of the spinner

variant.description: Determines the color of the spinner: `base` is gray, `brand` is blue, and `inverse` is white.

tabs.description: A tab keeps related content in a single container that is shown and hidden through navigation.

methods.name: isTabFromContainer
methods.docblock:
Determine if a node from event.target is a Tab element for the current Tabs container.
If the clicked element is not a Tab, it returns false.
If it finds another Tabs container between the Tab and `this`, it returns false.
methods.description:
Determine if a node from event.target is a Tab element for the current Tabs container.
If the clicked element is not a Tab, it returns false.
If it finds another Tabs container between the Tab and `this`, it returns false.

id.description: HTML `id` attribute of primary element that has `.slds-tabs--default` on it. Optional: If one is not supplied, a `shortid` will be created.

children.description:
The `children` are the actual tabs and panels to be displayed. Note that the structure of the `` component **does not** correspond to the DOM structure that is rendered. The `` component requires one or more children of type ``, which themselves require a `label` property which will be what shows in the `` and has `children`, which end up being the _contents of the tab's corresponding panel_. The component iterates through each `` and rendering one `` and one `` for each of them. The tab(s) end up being children of the ``. ```

This is my tab 1 contents!

They show when you click the first tab.

This is my tab 2 contents!

They show when you click the second tab.

 ```

className.description: Class names to be added to the container element and is passed along to its children.

defaultSelectedIndex.description: The Tab (and corresponding TabPanel) that is selected when the component first renders. Defaults to `0`.

onSelect.description: This function triggers when a tab is selected.

variant.description: If the Tabs should be scopped, defaults to false

selectedIndex.description: The Tab (and corresponding TabPanel) that is currently selected.

panel.description:
The `` component allows us to simplify the structure of the `` component. Rather than require different (deeply nested) children for tabslist, with its tab(s) as well as tabpanel(s), we provide this `TabsPanel` component which takes a `label` property that will become what is shown on the `` that will be associated with it. The `children` of the Panel will be fed to the `` component, while its `label` is handled in ``, via ``. ```

This is my tab 1 contents!

They show when you click the first tab.

 ```

label.description: The string or element that is handed off to the `<Tab />` component, ends up being the title and the label for the tab associated with its tab panel.

children.description:
The `children` are the actual tab panels to be rendered. They get created by [tabs/index.jsx](./index.jsx) in the `renderTabPanels` function.

Note that the `<TabsPanel />` component inserts a `div` element around the children, because React requires exactly one "parent" element returned. The `<TabPanel />` component simply dips down into `children` to get the children of this wrapping `div` so that it does not get rendered in the DOM.

panel.name: panel

aria-activedescendant.description: The aria-activedescendant attribute contains the ID of the currently active child object that is part of a composite widget within the Document Object Model. It makes do with the overhead of having all or more than one child focusable. As the name specifies, it helps in managing the current active child of the composite widget.

aria-autocomplete.description: Indicates if the suggestions in a composite widget are values that complete the current textbox input.

aria-controls.description:
An HTML ID that is shared with ARIA-supported devices with the
`aria-controls` attribute in order to relate the input with
another region of the page. An example would be a select box
that shows or hides a panel.

aria-describedby.description: The `aria-describedby` attribute is used to indicate the IDs of the elements that describe the object. It is used to establish a relationship between widgets or groups and text that described them. This is very similar to aria-labelledby: a label describes the essence of an object, while a description provides more information that the user might need.

aria-expanded.description: Use the `aria-expanded` state to indicate whether regions of the content are collapsible, and to expose whether a region is currently expanded or collapsed.

aria-haspopup.description: Indicates that the element has a popup context menu or sub-level menu.

aria-labelledby.description: The aria-labelledby attribute contains the element IDs of labels in objects such as input elements, widgets, and groups. The attribute establishes relationships between objects and their labels. Assistive technology, such as screen readers, use this attribute to catalog the objects in a document so that users can navigate between them. Without an element ID, the assistive technology cannot catalog the object.

aria-owns.description:
An HTML ID that is shared with ARIA-supported devices with the
`aria-controls` attribute in order to relate the input with
another region of the page. An example would be a search field
that shows search results.

aria-required.description: The `aria-required` attribute is used to indicate that user input is required on an element before a form can be submitted.

autoFocus.description: Specifies is the textarea should automatically get focus when the page loads. This is typically a poor user experience.

assistiveText.description:
**Assistive text for accessibility.**
* `label`: If present, the label associated with this `textarea` is overwritten by this text and is visually not shown.

children.description: Elements are added after the `textarea`.

className.description: Class names to be added to the textarea component.

classNameContainer.description: Allows for ability to apply classNames to outer textarea div.

disabled.description: Disables the textarea and prevents editing the contents.

errorText.description: Message to display when the textarea is in an error state. When this is present, also visually highlights the component as in error.

id.description: Every textarea must have a unique ID in order to support keyboard navigation and ARIA support.

textareaRef.description: This callback exposes the textarea reference / DOM node to parent components. `<Parent textareaRef={(textareaComponent) => this.textarea = textareaComponent} />

label.description: This label appears above the textarea.

onChange.description: This callback fires when the textarea changes. The synthetic React event will be the first parameter to the callback. You will probably want to reference `event.target.value` in your callback. No custom data object is provided.

onClick.description: This event fires when the textarea is clicked.

onInput.description: Similar to `onchange`. Triggered when an element gets user input.

onInvalid.description: Triggered when a submittable <input> element is invalid.

onKeyDown.description: Triggered when a key is pressed down

onKeyPress.description: Triggered when a key is pressed and released

onKeyUp.description: Triggered when a key is released

onSelect.description: Triggered after some text has been selected in an element.

onSubmit.description: Fires when a form is submitted.

name.description: Name of the submitted form parameter.

placeholder.description: Text that will appear in an empty textarea.

required.description: Highlights the textarea as a required field (does not perform any validation).

value.description: The textarea is a controlled component, and will always display this value.

defaultValue.description: The textarea is a uncontrolled component, and this will be the initial value.

wrap.description: Specifies how the text in a text area is to be wrapped when submitted in a form.

constrainToScrollParent.description: If true, constrains the menu to the scroll parent. See `Dropdown`.

disabled.description: Disables the input and prevents editing the contents.

inheritTargetWidth.description: Sets the dialog width to the width of the target. Menus attached to `input` typically follow this UX pattern.

label.description: This label appears above the input.

listItemRenderer.description: Custom element that overrides the default Menu Item component.

menuPosition.description:
Please select one of the following:
* `absolute` - (default) The dialog will use `position: absolute` and style attributes to position itself. This allows inverted placement or flipping of the dialog.
* `overflowBoundaryElement` - The dialog will overflow scrolling parents. Use on elements that are aligned to the left or right of their target and don't care about the target being within a scrolling parent. Typically this is a popover or tooltip. Dropdown menus can usually open up and down if no room exists. In order to achieve this a portal element will be created and attached to `body`. This element will render into that detached render tree.
* `relative` - No styling or portals will be used. Menus will be positioned relative to their triggers. This is a great choice for HTML snapshot testing.

placeholder.description: Text that will appear in an empty input.

required.description: If true, adds asterisk next to input label to indicate it is a required field.

strValue.description: Value for input that is parsed to create an internal state in the `date` format.

value.description: Instance an internal state in the `date` format.

toast.description: Toast serves as a feedback & confirmation mechanism after the user takes an action. View [banner guidelines](https://www.lightningdesignsystem.com/guidelines/messaging/components/banners/).

assistiveText.description:
**Assistive text for accessibility**
This object is merged with the default props object on every render.
* `closeButton`: This is a visually hidden label for the close button.
_Tested with snapshot testing._

className.description:
CSS classes to be added to tag with `.slds-notify_toast`. Uses `classNames` [API](https://github.com/JedWatson/classnames).
_Tested with snapshot testing._

duration.description: If duration exists, the Toast will disappear after that amount of time. Time in milliseconds. _Tested with Mocha testing._

labels.description:
**Text labels for internationalization**
This object is merged with the default props object on every render.
* `details`: Secondary text below heading
* `heading`: text within heading tag
* `headingLink`: Text of link that triggers `onClickHeadingLink`. Inline links should pass a keyed array of React components into `labels.heading`.

_Tested with snapshot testing._

onClickHeadingLink.description: Triggered by link. _Tested with Mocha testing._

icon.description:
Icon of type `~/components/icon`. This icon will be cloned and additional props appended. The default icons are:
* info variant: `utility:info`
* error variant: `utility:error`
* success variant: `utility:success`
* warning variant: `utility:warning`

_Tested with snapshot testing._

onRequestClose.description: Triggered by close button. _Tested with Mocha testing._

variant.description: The type of Toast. _Tested with snapshot testing._

container.description: A fixed container for toast banners.

className.description: CSS classes to be added to tag with `.slds-notify-container`. Uses `classNames` [API](https://github.com/JedWatson/classnames).

children.description: Toast components

container.name: container

tooltip.description: The PopoverTooltip component is variant of the Lightning Design System Popover component. This component wraps an element that triggers it to open. It must be a focusable child element (either a button or an anchor), so that keyboard users can navigate to it.

align.description: Alignment of the Tooltip relative to the element that triggers it.

assistiveText.description:
**Assistive text for accessibility**
This object is merged with the default props object on every render.
* `tooltipTipLearnMoreIcon`: This text is inside the info icon within the tooltip content and exists to "complete the sentence" for assistive tech users.
* `triggerLearnMoreIcon`: This text is inside the info icon that triggers the tooltip in order to have text within the link.

children.description: Pass the one element that triggers the Tooltip as a child. It must be an element with `tabIndex` or an element that already has a `tabIndex` set such as an anchor or a button, so that keyboard users can tab to it.

hasStaticAlignment.description: By default, dialogs will flip their alignment (such as bottom to top) if they extend beyond a boundary element such as a scrolling parent or a window/viewpoint. `hasStaticAlignment` disables this behavior and allows this component to extend beyond boundary elements. _Not tested._

id.description: A unique ID is needed in order to support keyboard navigation, ARIA support, and connect the popover to the triggering element.

labels.description:
**Text labels for internationalization**
This object is merged with the default props object on every render.
* `learnMoreAfter`: This label appears in the tooltip after the info icon.
* `learnMoreBefore`: This label appears in the tooltip before the info icon.

isOpen.description: Forces tooltip to be open. A value of `false` will disable any interaction with the tooltip.

triggerClassName.description: CSS classes to be added to tag with `slds-tooltip-trigger`.

position.description:
Please select one of the following:
* `absolute` - (default) The dialog will use `position: absolute` and style attributes to position itself. This allows inverted placement or flipping of the dialog.
* `overflowBoundaryElement` - The dialog will overflow scrolling parents. Use on elements that are aligned to the left or right of their target and don't care about the target being within a scrolling parent. Typically this is a popover or tooltip. Dropdown menus can usually open up and down if no room exists. In order to achieve this a portal element will be created and attached to `body`. This element will render into that detached render tree.
* `relative` - No styling or portals will be used. Menus will be positioned relative to their triggers. This is a great choice for HTML snapshot testing.

triggerStyle.description: Custom styles to be added to wrapping triggering `div`.

theme.description: Determines the theme of tooltip: for informative purpose (blue background) or warning purpose (red background). This used to be `variant`.

variant.description: Determines the type of the tooltip.

tree.description: A tree is visualization of a structure hierarchy. A branch can be expanded or collapsed. This is a controlled component, since visual state is present in the `nodes` data.

assistiveText.description:
**Assistive text for accessibility.**
This object is merged with the default props object on every render.
* `label`: For users of assistive technology, if set the heading will be hidden. One of `heading` or `assistiveText.label` must be set in order to label the tree.

className.description: Class names to be added to the container element which has the heading and the `ul.slds-tree` element as children.

listClassName.description: Class names to be added to the top-level `ul` element of the tree.

getNodes.description: A function that will be called by every branch to receive its child nodes. The parent `node` object with the branch data is passed into this function: `getNodes(node)`. If your state engine is Flux or Redux, then your tree data structure will probably be flattened or normalized within the store. This will allow you to build out your tree without transversing an actual tree of data and may be more performant.

heading.description: This is the tree's heading and describes its contents. It can be hidden, see `assistiveText`.

id.description: HTML `id` of primary element that has `.slds-tree` on it. This component has a wrapping container element outside of `.slds-tree`.

nodes.description:
Array of items starting at the top of the tree. The shape each node in the array is:
```
{
  expanded: string,
  id: string,
  label: string or node,
  selected: string,
  type: string,
  nodes: array
}
```
`assistiveText: string` is optional and helpful if the label is not a string. Only `id` and `label` are required. Use `type: 'branch'` for folder and categories.

onClick.description: Function that will run whenever an item or branch is selected due to click or keyboard navigation.

onExpandClick.description: This function triggers when the expand or collapse icon is clicked or due to keyboard navigation.

onScroll.description: This function triggers when the top-level `ul` element scrolls. This can be used to implement an "infinite scroll" pattern and update the `nodes` prop accordingly.

searchTerm.description: Highlights term if found in node label. This does not auto-expand branches.

listStyle.description: Styles to be added to the top-level `ul` element. Useful for `overflow:hidden`.
